name: Grilled Chicken Breast with Roasted Vegetables
description: Juicy grilled chicken breast served with a colorful medley of roasted vegetables. A classic high-protein dinner.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C) and preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high.
Toss vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil, half the garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway.
Brush chicken breasts with remaining olive oil and garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 165F (74C).
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve chicken over roasted vegetables.

name: Salmon with Quinoa and Asparagus
description: Omega-3 rich salmon fillet served with fluffy quinoa and tender asparagus spears.
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions (usually 1.5 cups quinoa to 3 cups water, simmer 15 min).
Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place salmon fillets on one side of the sheet, asparagus on the other.
Drizzle with olive oil, squeeze lemon juice, and season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until salmon flakes easily and asparagus is tender.
Fluff quinoa with fork and stir in fresh dill.
Serve salmon and asparagus over quinoa with lemon wedges.

name: Beef Stir Fry with Vegetables
description: Quick and flavorful Asian-style beef stir fry with crisp vegetables in a savory sauce.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a small bowl. Set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add beef slices in a single layer and sear for 1-2 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed. Stir fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli, peppers, and snap peas. Stir fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return beef to wok and pour sauce over. Toss to coat.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens. Serve immediately.

name: Turkey Meatballs with Marinara and Zucchini Noodles
description: Lean turkey meatballs in homemade marinara served over low-carb zucchini noodles.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix ground turkey, egg, breadcrumbs, parmesan, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and salt.
Form into 20 meatballs (about 1.5 tbsp each) and place on baking sheet.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through (internal temp 165F).
While meatballs bake, heat marinara sauce in a large pan over medium heat.
In another pan, saute zucchini noodles in olive oil for 2-3 minutes until just tender.
Add baked meatballs to marinara sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve meatballs and sauce over zucchini noodles.

name: Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas
description: Easy one-pan chicken fajitas with colorful peppers and onions. Perfect for busy weeknights.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Line a large baking sheet with foil.
Mix chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt in a small bowl.
Toss chicken and vegetables with olive oil and spice mixture.
Spread in a single layer on baking sheet.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring halfway, until chicken is cooked through.
Squeeze fresh lime juice over the fajita mixture.
Warm tortillas and serve with fajita filling.

name: Garlic Butter Shrimp with White Rice
description: Succulent shrimp sauteed in garlic butter served over fluffy white rice.
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Pat shrimp dry and season with salt.
Melt 2 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp in a single layer and cook 1-2 minutes per side until pink. Remove.
Add remaining butter and garlic to pan. Saute for 30 seconds.
Add wine and lemon juice. Simmer for 1 minute.
Return shrimp to pan, add red pepper flakes, and toss to coat.
Serve shrimp and sauce over rice, garnished with parsley.

name: Slow Cooker Beef Pot Roast
description: Tender fall-apart pot roast with carrots and potatoes, cooked low and slow.
instructions: Season beef roast generously with salt and pepper on all sides.
Sear roast in a hot skillet with oil for 2-3 minutes per side (optional but recommended).
Place potatoes, carrots, onion, and garlic in slow cooker.
Mix beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary.
Place roast on top of vegetables and pour broth mixture over.
Cook on LOW for 8-10 hours or HIGH for 4-5 hours until fork tender.
Slice or shred roast and serve with vegetables and cooking liquid.

name: Baked Cod with Lemon and Herbs
description: Light and flaky baked cod fillets with fresh lemon and Mediterranean herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Line a baking dish with parchment paper.
Pat cod fillets dry and place in baking dish.
Mix olive oil, minced garlic, oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle herb mixture over cod. Squeeze lemon juice on top.
Place lemon slices on fish and scatter capers if using.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

name: Chicken Teriyaki Rice Bowl
description: Japanese-inspired bowl with teriyaki glazed chicken, white rice, and steamed vegetables.
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Whisk soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 5-6 minutes until golden.
Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until sauce thickens.
Steam broccoli until tender-crisp.
Assemble bowls: rice on bottom, topped with teriyaki chicken and broccoli.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

name: Mediterranean Chicken with Olives and Tomatoes
description: One-pan Mediterranean chicken braised with tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C).
Season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken skin-side down for 5 minutes until golden. Flip and cook 2 more minutes.
Remove chicken. Add onion and garlic to pan, saute for 2 minutes.
Add tomatoes, olives, and chicken broth. Nestle chicken back in.
Transfer to oven and bake for 25 minutes until chicken reaches 165F.
Sprinkle with feta cheese and serve.

name: Pork Tenderloin with Apple Cider Glaze
description: Juicy roasted pork tenderloin with a sweet and tangy apple cider glaze.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Season pork tenderloin with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over high heat.
Sear pork on all sides, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer skillet to oven and roast for 15-20 minutes until internal temp reaches 145F.
Remove pork and let rest. Place skillet on stovetop over medium heat.
Add apple cider, mustard, maple syrup, vinegar, and garlic to pan.
Simmer for 5 minutes until glaze thickens. Slice pork and drizzle with glaze.

name: Black Bean and Chicken Burrito Bowl
description: Tex-Mex inspired bowl with seasoned chicken, black beans, corn, and fresh toppings.
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions. Stir in lime juice and cilantro.
Season chicken with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for 6-8 minutes until done.
Heat black beans and corn in microwave or small pan.
Assemble bowls: cilantro lime rice on bottom.
Top with chicken, black beans, corn, salsa, sour cream, and avocado.
Squeeze extra lime over top and serve.

name: Grilled Steak with Chimichurri
description: Perfectly grilled ribeye steak topped with fresh Argentine chimichurri sauce.
instructions: For chimichurri: Pulse parsley, cilantro, oregano, garlic in food processor.
Add olive oil, vinegar, red pepper flakes, and 0.5 tsp salt. Pulse until combined.
Let steaks come to room temperature for 30 minutes.
Season steaks generously with remaining salt and pepper.
Preheat grill to high heat. Grill steaks 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest steaks for 5-10 minutes before slicing against the grain.
Serve sliced steak topped generously with chimichurri.

name: Honey Garlic Glazed Salmon
description: Pan-seared salmon with a sticky honey garlic glaze. Ready in under 20 minutes.
instructions: Mix honey, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl.
Season salmon with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Place salmon skin-side up and sear for 3-4 minutes until golden.
Flip salmon and pour honey garlic sauce around the fish.
Cook for 4-5 more minutes, spooning sauce over salmon.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions. Serve immediately.

name: Tofu Stir Fry with Vegetables
description: Crispy pan-fried tofu with colorful vegetables in a savory garlic sauce.
instructions: Press tofu for 15 minutes to remove excess moisture. Cut into cubes.
Toss tofu cubes with 2 tbsp cornstarch until coated.
Heat 2 tbsp vegetable oil in wok over high heat. Fry tofu until golden, about 5 minutes. Remove.
Add remaining oil. Stir fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds.
Add all vegetables and stir fry for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and remaining cornstarch with 2 tbsp water.
Return tofu to wok, add sauce, and toss until everything is coated and sauce thickens.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken Thighs
description: Crispy-skinned chicken thighs roasted with lemon, garlic, and fresh herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C).
Pat chicken thighs dry with paper towels.
Rub chicken with olive oil and season with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Arrange chicken skin-side up in a baking dish.
Scatter garlic cloves and fresh herbs around chicken.
Slice one lemon and place slices on chicken. Juice the other lemon over top.
Roast for 35-40 minutes until skin is golden and internal temp reaches 165F.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Spaghetti with Turkey Bolognese
description: Classic Italian meat sauce made with lean ground turkey over whole wheat pasta.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute onion, carrots, and celery for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Add ground turkey and break up. Cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and Italian seasoning. Cook for 1 minute.
Add wine if using and let simmer for 2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and 0.5 cup water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook spaghetti according to package directions.
Serve sauce over pasta with grated parmesan.

name: Cajun Shrimp and Sausage Skillet
description: One-pan Cajun dish with spicy shrimp, andouille sausage, and vegetables.
instructions: Season shrimp with 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sausage and cook for 3-4 minutes until browned. Remove.
Add peppers, onion, and zucchini. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add garlic and remaining Cajun seasoning. Cook 1 minute.
Add shrimp and return sausage to pan. Cook 3-4 minutes until shrimp is pink.
Squeeze lemon over top and garnish with parsley.

name: Korean Beef Bulgogi Bowl
description: Marinated Korean-style beef served over white rice with pickled vegetables.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, pear, garlic, and ginger for marinade.
Add beef slices to marinade and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (or overnight).
Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Cook marinated beef in batches for 2-3 minutes per batch until caramelized.
Assemble bowls with rice topped with bulgogi beef.
Garnish with green onions, sesame seeds, and cucumber slices.

name: Balsamic Glazed Chicken with Roasted Sweet Potatoes
description: Sweet and tangy balsamic chicken paired with caramelized roasted sweet potatoes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C).
Toss sweet potato cubes with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on baking sheet.
Roast sweet potatoes for 20 minutes.
Whisk balsamic vinegar, honey, mustard, and garlic for the glaze.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Heat remaining oil in oven-safe skillet. Sear chicken 3 minutes per side.
Pour half the glaze over chicken. Transfer to oven with sweet potatoes.
Bake for 15 minutes. Drizzle remaining glaze before serving.

name: Thai Basil Chicken (Pad Krapow Gai)
description: Authentic Thai street food with ground chicken, holy basil, and a fried egg.
instructions: Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in wok over high heat. Add garlic and chilies, stir for 30 seconds.
Add ground chicken and break up. Cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Stir to combine.
Turn off heat and add Thai basil. Toss until wilted.
Fry eggs sunny-side up in remaining oil.
Serve chicken over rice topped with a fried egg.

name: Herb Crusted Pork Chops
description: Juicy bone-in pork chops with a crispy herb and parmesan crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Mix breadcrumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Pat pork chops dry. Brush both sides with dijon mustard.
Press breadcrumb mixture onto both sides of pork chops.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops for 2 minutes per side until crust is golden.
Transfer skillet to oven and bake for 15-18 minutes until internal temp reaches 145F.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with seasoned ground beef, rice, and cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Cook rice according to package directions.
Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Drain excess fat.
Stir in cooked rice, diced tomatoes, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Pour tomato sauce into bottom of baking dish.
Stuff each pepper with beef mixture. Place upright in dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes.
Remove foil, top with cheese, and bake 10 more minutes until melted.

name: Miso Glazed Black Cod
description: Restaurant-quality miso glazed cod with a caramelized, umami-rich exterior.
instructions: Mix miso, mirin, sake, sugar, and ginger until smooth.
Coat fish with miso mixture and marinate for at least 2 hours (overnight is best).
Preheat broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with foil.
Wipe excess marinade off fish and place on baking sheet.
Broil 3-4 inches from heat for 8-10 minutes until caramelized and fish flakes.
Watch carefully to prevent burning.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

name: Greek Chicken Souvlaki Plate
description: Marinated grilled chicken skewers with tzatziki, pita, and Greek salad.
instructions: Mix 3 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 3 cloves garlic, oregano, and salt for marinade.
Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes.
For tzatziki: mix yogurt, grated cucumber (squeezed dry), remaining garlic, and lemon juice.
Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill over high heat for 4-5 minutes per side.
Make quick salad with tomatoes, onion, feta, remaining olive oil, and lemon juice.
Warm pita bread on grill for 30 seconds per side.
Serve skewers with tzatziki, pita, and salad.

name: One-Pan Italian Sausage with Peppers and Onions
description: Classic Italian-American dish with sweet Italian sausage, peppers, and onions.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Toss peppers and onions with olive oil, garlic, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a large baking sheet. Nestle sausages among vegetables.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, turning sausages halfway through.
Drizzle balsamic vinegar over vegetables.
Serve sausages and vegetables in hoagie rolls or over rice.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chicken pieces in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce. A British-Indian classic.
instructions: Mix yogurt with 1 tbsp garam masala and cumin. Marinate chicken for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a large pan. Cook chicken in batches until browned. Remove.
Add onion to pan and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Add garlic, ginger, remaining garam masala, paprika, and turmeric. Cook 1 minute.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and return chicken to pan.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce thickens.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

name: Blackened Tilapia Tacos
description: Spicy blackened fish tacos with cabbage slaw and chipotle crema.
instructions: Mix paprika, cumin, garlic powder, cayenne, and 0.5 tsp salt for blackening spice.
Coat tilapia fillets with spice mixture on both sides.
For crema: mix sour cream, chipotle, and juice of half a lime.
Toss cabbage with juice of one lime and a pinch of salt.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over high heat. Cook fish 3-4 minutes per side.
Flake fish into large pieces.
Warm tortillas and assemble tacos with fish, slaw, crema, and cilantro.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
description: Italian hunter-style chicken braised with tomatoes, peppers, and herbs.
instructions: Season chicken thighs with salt and Italian seasoning.
Place onion, peppers, and mushrooms in bottom of slow cooker.
Nestle chicken pieces on top of vegetables.
Mix crushed tomatoes, wine, broth, garlic, oregano, and capers.
Pour sauce over chicken and vegetables.
Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or HIGH for 3-4 hours.
Serve chicken with sauce over pasta or polenta.

name: Asian Glazed Pork Belly Bites
description: Crispy caramelized pork belly cubes with a sweet and savory Asian glaze.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Toss pork belly cubes with 2 tbsp soy sauce and five spice powder.
Spread on baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes, stirring once.
Mix remaining soy sauce, honey, hoisin, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger for glaze.
Drain fat from pan. Pour glaze over pork belly.
Return to oven and bake 20-25 more minutes, basting occasionally, until caramelized.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Serve pork belly over rice, garnished with sesame seeds and green onions.

name: Homemade California Roll
description: Classic inside-out sushi roll with imitation crab, creamy avocado, and crisp cucumber. A perfect introduction to homemade sushi!
instructions: Rinse sushi rice in cold water until water runs clear (about 4-5 rinses). This removes excess starch for stickier rice.
Cook rice with 1.75 cups water: bring to boil, reduce to low, cover and simmer 18 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes.
While rice cools slightly, mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until dissolved.
Transfer rice to a large wooden or glass bowl. Gently fold in vinegar mixture using cutting motions - do not mash. Fan rice while mixing to cool it and add shine.
Cover rice with damp towel and let it come to room temperature.
Mix shredded imitation crab with mayonnaise in a small bowl.
Place bamboo rolling mat on work surface. Cover with plastic wrap to prevent sticking.
Place a nori sheet shiny-side down on the mat. Wet your hands and spread 3/4 cup rice evenly over nori, leaving 1-inch border at top.
Sprinkle rice with sesame seeds. Flip nori so rice is face-down on the plastic wrap (this creates inside-out roll).
Arrange a line of crab mixture, avocado slices, and cucumber strips along the center of the nori.
Using the mat, roll away from you, tucking filling tightly. Apply gentle, even pressure.
Wet a sharp knife and slice roll into 6-8 pieces, cleaning knife between cuts.
Repeat with remaining ingredients to make 4 rolls total.
Serve immediately with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

name: Spicy Tuna Roll
description: Fresh sushi-grade tuna mixed with spicy mayo, wrapped in seasoned rice and nori with crisp cucumber.
instructions: Rinse and cook sushi rice as directed. Season with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt mixture.
Make spicy tuna: combine diced tuna, mayonnaise, sriracha, and sesame oil. Mix gently to keep texture.
Place nori sheet on bamboo mat, shiny side down.
Spread 3/4 cup seasoned rice evenly over nori.
Flip nori so rice faces down for inside-out roll.
Place a line of spicy tuna mixture and cucumber strips in the center.
Roll tightly using the bamboo mat, sealing the edge.
Slice into 6-8 pieces with a wet, sharp knife.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onion.
Serve with soy sauce for dipping.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry
description: Restaurant-quality Chinese beef and broccoli with tender sirloin in a savory garlic-ginger sauce.
instructions: Slice beef thin against the grain. Toss with 1 tbsp cornstarch and 1 tbsp soy sauce. Let marinate 15 minutes.
Mix remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, beef broth, remaining cornstarch, and brown sugar for the sauce.
Blanch broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes until bright green. Drain and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat until smoking.
Add beef in a single layer and sear without stirring for 1 minute. Stir-fry until browned, about 2 more minutes. Remove.
Add more oil if needed. Stir-fry garlic and ginger for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add broccoli and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Return beef to wok and pour in sauce. Toss until sauce thickens and coats everything, about 2 minutes.
Drizzle with sesame oil and serve immediately over rice.

name: Thai Basil Chicken Stir Fry
description: Authentic Thai street food with ground chicken, fresh Thai basil, and fiery chilies served over jasmine rice with a crispy fried egg.
instructions: Cook jasmine rice according to package directions and keep warm.
Mix fish sauce, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar in a small bowl.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat until smoking.
Add garlic, shallots, and chilies. Stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground chicken and break apart with spatula. Cook until no longer pink, about 4-5 minutes.
Pour in sauce mixture and stir to combine. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Turn off heat and add Thai basil. Toss until just wilted but still vibrant green.
In a separate pan, fry eggs sunny-side up in remaining oil until edges are crispy.
Serve chicken over rice, topped with a fried egg.

name: Salmon Teriyaki
description: Pan-seared salmon glazed with homemade teriyaki sauce, topped with sesame seeds. A Japanese classic.
instructions: Make teriyaki sauce: combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, honey, garlic, and ginger in a small bowl.
Pat salmon fillets dry and season with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Place salmon skin-side up and sear for 3-4 minutes until golden crust forms.
Flip salmon to skin-side down and cook for 2 more minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low and pour teriyaki sauce around the salmon.
Spoon sauce over salmon repeatedly as it thickens, about 3-4 minutes.
Cook until salmon reaches desired doneness and sauce is glossy.
Serve over rice with steamed broccoli.
Garnish with sesame seeds and green onion.

name: Chicken Teriyaki Bowl
description: Classic Japanese-style teriyaki chicken over fluffy rice with steamed broccoli and carrots
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Make teriyaki sauce: whisk soy sauce, mirin, honey, rice vinegar, garlic, ginger, and cornstarch with 2 tbsp water.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken pieces and cook for 5-6 minutes until golden brown.
Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken and simmer for 5-7 minutes until sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
Steam broccoli and carrots until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with teriyaki chicken, broccoli, and carrots.
Drizzle remaining sauce over the bowl and garnish with sesame seeds and green onion.

name: Tofu Buddha Bowl
description: Nourishing vegetarian bowl with crispy tofu, quinoa, chickpeas, roasted vegetables, and creamy tahini dressing
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Rinse quinoa and cook according to package directions.
Toss sweet potato cubes with 1 tbsp olive oil, cumin, and paprika. Spread on baking sheet.
Toss chickpeas with 0.5 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of paprika. Add to baking sheet.
Roast sweet potato and chickpeas for 20 minutes.
Add broccoli to the pan and roast for another 10-15 minutes.
Press tofu, cube, and pan-fry in remaining olive oil until golden and crispy, about 8 minutes.
Make tahini dressing: whisk tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and 2-3 tbsp water until smooth.
Divide quinoa between bowls.
Arrange tofu, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and raw red cabbage on top.
Drizzle generously with tahini dressing and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Korean Beef Bowl
description: Savory Korean-style beef bulgogi served over rice with kimchi, a fried egg, and pickled vegetables
instructions: Make bulgogi marinade: whisk soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, brown sugar, grated pear, garlic, ginger, and gochujang if using.
Add sliced beef to marinade and let sit for at least 15 minutes (or up to overnight in refrigerator).
Cook white rice according to package directions.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Cook marinated beef in batches for 2-3 minutes per batch, allowing it to get caramelized edges. Set aside.
In the same pan, fry eggs sunny-side up to your preference.
Divide rice between bowls.
Top with bulgogi beef, a fried egg, and kimchi on the side.
Drizzle with remaining sesame oil and garnish with green onion and sesame seeds.

name: Loaded Chicken Burrito Bowl
description: Restaurant-style burrito bowl with cilantro lime rice, seasoned chicken, black beans, salsa, cheese, and sour cream
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions. Stir in juice of 1 lime and half the cilantro when done.
Mix cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper for seasoning.
Coat chicken breasts with seasoning and 1 tbsp olive oil.
Grill or pan-sear chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until internal temp reaches 165F.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice or dice.
Warm black beans in a small saucepan with a splash of water.
Divide cilantro lime rice between bowls.
Top with seasoned chicken, black beans, salsa, shredded cheese, and lettuce.
Add a dollop of sour cream and remaining cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

name: Honey Garlic Chicken Thighs
description: Tender, juicy chicken thighs glazed with a sweet and savory honey garlic sauce. A quick weeknight favorite.
instructions: Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and pepper.
Whisk together honey, soy sauce, garlic, rice vinegar, ginger, and cornstarch.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken thighs and cook for 5-6 minutes per side until golden brown.
Pour honey garlic sauce over chicken and reduce heat to medium.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes, basting chicken, until sauce thickens and chicken reaches 165F.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve immediately over white rice or with steamed vegetables.

name: Pan-Seared Ribeye Steak with Herb Butter
description: Restaurant-quality ribeye steak seared to perfection and topped with melting compound herb butter.
instructions: Remove steaks from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to bring to room temperature.
Mix softened butter with rosemary, thyme, and garlic. Roll into a log and refrigerate.
Pat steaks dry and season generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over high heat until smoking. Add olive oil.
Sear steaks for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare (adjust time for desired doneness).
Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
Slice herb butter and place on top of hot steaks.
Serve immediately with your choice of sides.

name: Miso Glazed Salmon
description: Japanese-inspired salmon fillets with a caramelized miso glaze. Rich in omega-3s and incredibly flavorful.
instructions: Whisk together miso paste, mirin, sake, honey, sesame oil, and ginger.
Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish and coat with miso glaze.
Marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to 2 hours in refrigerator.
Preheat broiler to high and line a baking sheet with foil.
Place salmon skin-side down on baking sheet.
Broil for 8-10 minutes until glaze is caramelized and salmon flakes easily.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.
Serve with white rice and steamed vegetables.

name: Carnitas Tacos
description: Slow-cooked pulled pork carnitas in warm corn tortillas with fresh cilantro, onion, and lime.
instructions: Season pork chunks generously with salt, pepper, cumin, and oregano.
Place pork in slow cooker with orange juice, half the lime juice, and garlic.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4 hours until pork shreds easily.
Shred pork and crisp in a hot skillet for 5 minutes for crispy edges.
Warm corn tortillas in a dry skillet.
Fill tortillas with carnitas, topped with diced onion and cilantro.
Drizzle with remaining lime juice and serve with salsa verde.
Serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

name: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Chicken and Vegetables
description: One-pan meal with tender chicken thighs, potatoes, and seasonal vegetables in a bright lemon herb sauce.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C).
Toss potatoes with 1 tbsp olive oil and spread on a large baking sheet.
Roast potatoes for 15 minutes.
Mix remaining olive oil with garlic, thyme, rosemary, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
Coat chicken thighs with herb mixture.
Add chicken to sheet pan with potatoes. Add green beans and tomatoes around chicken.
Squeeze lemon juice over everything and place lemon halves on pan.
Roast for 25 minutes until chicken reaches 165F and vegetables are tender.

name: Thai Basil Beef Stir Fry
description: Spicy Thai-style stir fry with tender beef, fresh Thai basil, and a savory sauce served over white rice.
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Mix fish sauce, oyster sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat until smoking.
Add beef in a single layer and sear for 1-2 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add more oil if needed. Stir fry garlic and chilies for 30 seconds.
Add bell pepper and stir fry for 2 minutes.
Return beef to wok and pour sauce over. Toss to coat.
Remove from heat and stir in Thai basil until wilted.
Serve immediately over white rice.

name: Garlic Parmesan Baked Tilapia
description: Light and flaky tilapia fillets baked with a crispy garlic parmesan topping. Ready in under 20 minutes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix melted butter with garlic.
Combine parmesan, panko, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Pat tilapia fillets dry and place on baking sheet.
Brush fillets with garlic butter mixture.
Top each fillet with parmesan mixture, pressing gently to adhere.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily and topping is golden.
Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Turkey
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with seasoned ground turkey, white rice, and melted cheese. A complete meal in one.

ingredients.notes: mixed colors, tops cut off and seeded

instructions: Preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat olive oil in a skillet. Saute onion for 3 minutes, add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned, breaking into crumbles.
Stir in half the diced tomatoes, cooked rice, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Arrange peppers in a baking dish. Fill each with turkey mixture.
Pour remaining diced tomatoes around peppers and add 1/4 cup water to dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Uncover, top with cheese, and bake 10 more minutes until cheese melts.

name: Spicy Shrimp and Broccoli
description: Quick and healthy stir fry with succulent shrimp and crisp broccoli in a spicy garlic sauce.
instructions: Mix soy sauce, sriracha, honey, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a bowl.
Blanch broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, drain and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok over high heat.
Add shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes per side until pink. Remove and set aside.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes to wok, stir for 30 seconds.
Return shrimp and add broccoli to wok.
Pour sauce over and toss to coat. Cook for 2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately.

name: Italian Sausage and Peppers
description: Classic Italian-American dish with seared sausages, sweet bell peppers, and onions in a savory tomato sauce.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sausages and brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add peppers and onions to skillet. Cook for 8-10 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and Italian seasoning, cook for 1 minute.
Pour in crushed tomatoes and stir to combine.
Return sausages to skillet, nestling into vegetables.
Cover and simmer for 15 minutes until sausages are cooked through.
Garnish with fresh basil and serve over crusty bread or with pasta.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chunks of marinated chicken in a rich, creamy tomato-based curry sauce. A British-Indian classic.
instructions: Mix yogurt with half the garam masala, cumin, and turmeric. Marinate chicken for at least 20 minutes.
Thread chicken on skewers and grill or broil for 10-12 minutes until charred. Set aside.
Melt butter in a large pan. Saute onion for 5 minutes.
Add garlic, ginger, remaining spices, and cayenne. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Add grilled chicken to sauce and simmer for 5 minutes to coat.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with white rice or naan bread.

name: Balsamic Glazed Pork Chops
description: Juicy pan-seared pork chops finished with a sweet and tangy balsamic reduction.
instructions: Let pork chops come to room temperature for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops for 4-5 minutes per side until golden brown and internal temp reaches 145F.
Remove pork chops and let rest on a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and rosemary to pan, cook 30 seconds.
Pour in balsamic vinegar and honey. Simmer for 3-4 minutes until reduced by half.
Swirl in remaining butter to finish the sauce.
Drizzle balsamic glaze over pork chops and serve.

name: Seared Ahi Tuna with Sesame Crust
description: Restaurant-quality seared ahi tuna steaks with a crunchy sesame crust, served with wasabi and soy.
instructions: Pat tuna steaks completely dry with paper towels.
Brush tuna with sesame oil and season lightly with salt.
Press sesame seeds onto all sides of the tuna steaks.
Heat vegetable oil in a cast-iron skillet over high heat until smoking.
Sear tuna for 45-60 seconds per side for rare (longer for medium-rare).
Remove from heat and let rest for 1 minute.
Slice tuna against the grain into 1/2-inch slices.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, pickled ginger, and green onions.

name: Greek Chicken Souvlaki Bowls
description: Mediterranean-inspired bowls with grilled chicken, tzatziki, fresh vegetables, feta, and fluffy white rice.

ingredients.notes: diced for salad, grated for tzatziki

instructions: Marinate chicken cubes in 2 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, half the garlic, and oregano for 20 minutes.
Make tzatziki: mix Greek yogurt with grated cucumber (squeezed dry), remaining garlic, dill, and lemon juice.
Cook white rice according to package directions.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Prepare salad: toss diced cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olives, and feta with remaining olive oil.
Divide rice between bowls and top with grilled chicken.
Add Greek salad on the side and drizzle generously with tzatziki.
Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Cajun Blackened Chicken
description: Spicy Cajun-seasoned chicken breasts seared to perfection with a flavorful charred crust.
instructions: Mix all spices together in a small bowl to make Cajun seasoning.
Pat chicken breasts dry and coat generously with Cajun seasoning on both sides.
Heat a cast-iron skillet over high heat until very hot (almost smoking).
Add olive oil and 1 tbsp butter to skillet.
Place chicken in skillet and cook for 5-6 minutes without moving.
Flip chicken, add remaining butter, and cook 5-6 more minutes until internal temp reaches 165F.
Baste chicken with melted butter while cooking.
Let rest for 3 minutes before slicing. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Mongolian Beef
description: Sweet and savory stir-fried beef with green onions in a rich soy and brown sugar sauce. Better than takeout!
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Toss sliced beef with cornstarch until evenly coated.
Heat oil in a wok over high heat. Fry beef in batches for 2 minutes until crispy. Set aside.
Drain all but 1 tbsp oil from wok.
Add garlic and ginger, stir fry for 30 seconds.
Add soy sauce, brown sugar, and water. Bring to a simmer.
Return beef to wok and toss to coat in sauce.
Add green onions and cook for 1 minute until sauce thickens.
Serve over white rice, garnished with sesame seeds.

name: Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb
description: Elegant rack of lamb with a fragrant herb and mustard crust. Perfect for special occasions.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425F (220C). Let lamb come to room temperature for 30 minutes.
Season lamb generously with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over high heat. Sear lamb on all sides, 2 minutes per side.
Mix breadcrumbs, herbs, garlic, and remaining olive oil to make herb crust.
Brush top and sides of lamb with Dijon mustard.
Press herb mixture firmly onto mustard-coated surfaces.
Roast for 15-20 minutes for medium-rare (internal temp 130F).
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing between ribs to serve.

name: Shrimp Scampi with Linguine
description: Classic Italian-American dish with succulent shrimp in a garlicky white wine butter sauce over pasta.
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook shrimp 1-2 minutes per side. Remove.
Reduce heat to medium. Add 2 tbsp butter and garlic. Saute for 1 minute.
Add white wine and lemon juice. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Add remaining butter, red pepper flakes, and cooked pasta. Toss to coat.
Add pasta water if needed to loosen sauce.
Return shrimp to pan and toss. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Shawarma Wraps
description: Middle Eastern-spiced chicken wrapped in warm flatbread with garlic sauce, pickles, and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Mix cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cayenne, half the garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, and lemon juice.
Marinate chicken in spice mixture for at least 20 minutes (or overnight).
Make garlic sauce: mix Greek yogurt with remaining garlic and a pinch of salt.
Heat remaining oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice thinly.
Warm pita bread in a dry pan or microwave.
Assemble wraps: spread garlic sauce, add chicken, lettuce, tomato, and pickles. Roll up and serve.

name: Beef and Mushroom Stroganoff
description: Tender strips of beef and mushrooms in a rich, creamy sauce served over egg noodles. Russian comfort food.
instructions: Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Season beef strips with salt and pepper.
Melt 1 tbsp butter in a large skillet over high heat. Sear beef in batches for 2 minutes. Set aside.
Add remaining butter, onion, and mushrooms. Cook for 5-6 minutes until golden.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Sprinkle flour over and stir.
Pour in beef broth, Worcestershire, and mustard. Simmer for 5 minutes until thickened.
Remove from heat and stir in sour cream.
Return beef to pan and toss. Serve over egg noodles, garnished with parsley.

name: Coconut Curry Shrimp
description: Succulent shrimp simmered in a creamy coconut curry sauce with vegetables. Thai-inspired comfort food.
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute.
Add curry paste and stir for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in coconut milk and fish sauce. Stir to combine.
Add bell pepper and snap peas. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook for 4-5 minutes until pink and cooked through.
Remove from heat and stir in lime juice and basil.
Serve curry over white rice with extra lime wedges.

name: BBQ Pulled Pork
description: Slow-cooked pulled pork smothered in smoky BBQ sauce. Perfect for sandwiches or bowls.
instructions: Mix paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, salt, and pepper for dry rub.
Rub spice mixture all over pork shoulder.
Place onion quarters in bottom of slow cooker. Set pork on top.
Mix 1/2 cup BBQ sauce with apple cider vinegar. Pour over pork.
Cook on LOW for 8-10 hours or HIGH for 5-6 hours until pork shreds easily.
Remove pork and shred with two forks.
Discard cooking liquid or strain and save. Return pork to slow cooker.
Add remaining BBQ sauce and brown sugar. Stir and keep warm until serving.
Serve on whole grain buns with extra sauce.

name: Lemon Butter Scallops
description: Pan-seared sea scallops with a golden crust in a luscious lemon butter sauce. Restaurant-quality seafood at home.
instructions: Remove side muscle from scallops and pat completely dry with paper towels.
Season scallops with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large skillet over high heat.
Add scallops in a single layer, not touching. Sear for 2 minutes without moving.
Flip scallops and sear 1-2 more minutes until golden. Remove from pan.
Reduce heat to medium. Add remaining butter and garlic. Cook 30 seconds.
Add white wine and lemon juice. Simmer for 1 minute.
Return scallops to pan, add capers if using, and spoon sauce over.
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

name: Turkey Taco Lettuce Wraps
description: Low-carb taco night with seasoned ground turkey in crisp butter lettuce cups. All the flavor, fewer carbs.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add ground turkey and break into crumbles. Cook for 6-8 minutes until browned.
Add taco seasoning and 1/4 cup water. Simmer for 3-4 minutes until absorbed.
Wash and dry lettuce leaves, creating cup shapes.
Spoon seasoned turkey into lettuce cups.
Top with diced tomato, shredded cheese, and avocado slices.
Add a dollop of sour cream and salsa.
Garnish with cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.

name: Tuscan White Bean and Sausage Skillet
description: Rustic Italian one-pan meal with Italian sausage, creamy white beans, and fresh spinach in a garlicky broth.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sausage and break into pieces. Cook for 6-8 minutes until browned.
Add garlic, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes. Cook 1 minute.
Add cherry tomatoes and sun-dried tomatoes. Cook 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and add cannellini beans. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add spinach in handfuls, stirring until wilted.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with parmesan.
Serve with crusty bread for dipping.

name: Ginger Soy Glazed Salmon with Bok Choy
description: Asian-inspired salmon fillets with a sweet ginger soy glaze, served with sauteed baby bok choy.
instructions: Whisk together soy sauce, honey, ginger, garlic, and rice vinegar for glaze.
Pat salmon dry and season with salt and pepper.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add salmon skin-side up and cook 4 minutes. Flip and cook 2 more minutes.
Pour half the glaze over salmon and cook 2-3 more minutes until caramelized.
Remove salmon and set aside.
Add sesame oil to pan. Saute bok choy cut-side down for 3-4 minutes.
Add remaining glaze and cook until bok choy is tender-crisp.
Serve salmon over bok choy, garnished with green onions and sesame seeds.

name: Chicken Marsala
description: Italian-American classic with tender chicken cutlets in a rich Marsala wine and mushroom sauce.
instructions: Season flour with salt and pepper. Dredge chicken cutlets in flour, shaking off excess.
Heat olive oil and 2 tbsp butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken for 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining butter and mushrooms. Saute for 5 minutes until golden.
Add shallot and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in Marsala wine and chicken broth. Simmer for 5 minutes, scraping up brown bits.
Add thyme and return chicken to pan.
Simmer for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Jamaican Jerk Chicken
description: Spicy and aromatic Caribbean-style grilled chicken with authentic jerk seasoning. Served with coconut rice.
instructions: Blend scotch bonnet, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, allspice, thyme, and cinnamon to make jerk paste.
Coat chicken thighs with jerk paste and marinate for at least 1 hour (overnight is best).
Cook rice in coconut milk plus 1.5 cups water according to package directions.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Grill chicken for 8-10 minutes per side until internal temp reaches 165F.
Alternatively, bake at 400F for 35-40 minutes.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Serve with coconut rice and lime wedges.

name: One-Pan Garlic Butter Steak and Asparagus
description: Perfectly seared sirloin steak with tender asparagus, all cooked in one pan with garlic butter.
instructions: Pat steaks dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large cast-iron skillet over high heat.
Add steaks and sear for 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Move steaks to one side of pan. Add asparagus to other side.
Add butter, garlic, rosemary, and thyme to pan.
Baste steaks with melted butter while asparagus cooks, about 3-4 minutes.
Remove steaks and let rest for 5 minutes.
Continue cooking asparagus if needed until tender-crisp.
Serve steak with asparagus, drizzled with pan butter and lemon juice.

name: Mediterranean Baked Fish with Tomatoes and Olives
description: Light and flavorful white fish baked with cherry tomatoes, olives, capers, and fresh herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Place fish fillets in a baking dish. Season with salt, pepper, and half the oregano.
Scatter tomatoes, olives, capers, and garlic around fish.
Drizzle everything with olive oil and white wine.
Squeeze half the lemon over the dish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until fish flakes easily.
Sprinkle with remaining oregano and fresh parsley.
Serve with remaining lemon wedges and crusty bread.

name: Beef and Broccoli
description: Classic Chinese-American takeout favorite with tender beef and crisp broccoli in a savory brown sauce.
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Toss beef slices with 1 tbsp cornstarch and 1 tbsp soy sauce. Set aside.
Mix remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, beef broth, remaining cornstarch, and sesame oil.
Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Stir-fry beef for 2-3 minutes. Remove.
Add remaining oil. Stir-fry broccoli for 3-4 minutes until bright green.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
Return beef to wok and pour sauce over. Stir until sauce thickens.
Serve immediately over white rice.

name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
description: Juicy chicken breasts stuffed with a savory spinach and feta mixture. Low-carb and impressive.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F (200C).
Saute spinach and garlic in 1 tbsp olive oil until wilted. Let cool.
Mix cooled spinach with feta, cream cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and half the Italian seasoning.
Cut a horizontal pocket in each chicken breast, being careful not to cut through.
Stuff each breast with spinach-feta mixture. Secure with toothpicks.
Season outside of chicken with remaining Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Heat remaining olive oil in an oven-safe skillet. Sear chicken 3 minutes per side.
Transfer to oven and bake for 20-25 minutes until internal temp reaches 165F.
Remove toothpicks, let rest 5 minutes, and serve.

name: Thai Peanut Chicken
description: Grilled chicken with a creamy Thai peanut sauce made with PB Fit. Served over white rice with fresh vegetables.
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
Make peanut sauce: whisk PB Fit with coconut milk, 2 tbsp soy sauce, juice of 1 lime, honey, garlic, ginger, and sriracha.
Marinate chicken in remaining soy sauce and juice of 1 lime for 10 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Divide rice between bowls and top with sliced chicken.
Drizzle generously with peanut sauce.
Garnish with cucumber, cilantro, and crushed peanuts.

name: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
description: Aromatic slow-braised lamb with dried apricots, chickpeas, and warming Moroccan spices.
instructions: Season lamb chunks with salt, pepper, and half the spices.
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven or tagine over medium-high heat.
Brown lamb in batches, about 3-4 minutes per batch. Set aside.
Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and remaining spices. Cook 1 minute until fragrant.
Return lamb to pot with chicken broth, honey, and apricots.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 1.5-2 hours.
Add chickpeas in the last 30 minutes of cooking.
Garnish with cilantro and toasted almonds. Serve with couscous.

name: Chimichurri Skirt Steak
description: Perfectly grilled skirt steak topped with vibrant Argentine chimichurri sauce. Quick and incredibly flavorful.
instructions: Make chimichurri: pulse parsley, cilantro, oregano, and garlic in food processor.
Add olive oil, red wine vinegar, red pepper flakes, and 0.5 tsp salt. Pulse until combined but still chunky.
Let steak come to room temperature for 20 minutes.
Season steak generously with remaining salt and pepper.
Preheat grill or cast-iron pan to high heat.
Grill steak 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice against the grain.
Spoon chimichurri generously over steak slices and serve with lime wedges.

name: Turkey and Vegetable Meatloaf
description: Healthy meatloaf made with lean ground turkey and hidden vegetables. Topped with a tangy tomato glaze.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C).
Mix ground turkey, grated zucchini, carrot, onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, Worcestershire, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Shape mixture into a loaf on a baking sheet lined with foil.
Mix ketchup, brown sugar, and apple cider vinegar for glaze.
Spread half the glaze over the meatloaf.
Bake for 40 minutes.
Spread remaining glaze on top and bake 15 more minutes until internal temp reaches 165F.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
